result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Maintain absolute sobriety
*Provide DNA Sample

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dalton M Lager

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court Memo from DOC dated 12/15/16 in re:  Unpaid Court Obligations and Remaining Community Service
Review hearing on December 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dalton M Lager in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-399 and 15TR-1610.

9:35 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court, 
State moves to amend Count 1 in 15CM-399 to: 961.41(3g)(b) 
Defendant will plead to amended charge of Count 1 in 15CM-399. Conditional discharge 961.47.
Count 2 would be dismissed and read in

Defendant will also plead to 15TR-1610

Court informs Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.
Court questions Defendant on his waiver of counsel.
Defendant still wishes to proceed without an attorney.
Court continues questioning Defendant as to his waiver of counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant's waiver is competent.

Defendant enters a plea of:  15CM-399: Amended Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15TR-1610: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney Cousins  stipulates that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to WITHOLD entry of Judgment of Conviction this date for 15CM-399.
15CM-399: Count 1: 961.41(3g)(b)  - Possession of a Controlled Substance
15CM-399: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date for 15TR-1610.
15TR-1610: OWI 1st

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 


BY THE COURT:
15CM-399:
Amended Count 1:
Sentence is withheld
Probation for a period of 12 Months under Conditional Discharge 961.47
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $25 plus costs
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge
Perform 25 Hours of Community Service
Continue with AODA treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess/consume controlled substances or illegal drugs without a valid prescription and be taken only as prescribed
Provide DNA Sample
If Defendant successfully completes probation, Court will dismiss the matter

15TR-1610:
$300 fine plus costs which totals $1,000.50
$26.45 blood draw fee
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
6 Month DL Revocation
6 Months IID
DOT assessment and safety plan
Do not possess or use any controlled substances.

Defendant Dalton M Lager in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant makes statements re: counsel. 

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
